title.rendered: Apple Launched Its Latest MacBook Pro Models

content.rendered:
Today in its special event, Apple launched its latest MacBook Pro. As stated earlier, Apple has come out with a complete redesign to make the latest MacBook Pro thinner, lighter, and more dominant than the earlier series. The new MacBook Pro is introduced with three new variants,

  • A 13-inch MacBook Pro with the new Touch Bar
  • A 13-inch new MacBook Pro with traditional function keys,
  • And 15-inch model which is bigger and more powerful.

All models are shown as ‘Coming Soon’ on the website of Apple India. Talking about its price, the new 13-inch MacBook Pro having traditional function keys starts from Rs 1,29,900 whereas the 13-inch with the new Touch Bar starts from Rs 1,55,900 and the 15-inch model starts at Rs 2,05,900.

The new MacBook comes with Force Touch trackpads which are 46 per cent bigger on the 13-inch MacBook Pro and twice as big on the 15-inch MacBook. Also, the 2nd generation butterfly mechanism makes the typing more comfortable and responsive. Moreover, the MacOS Sierra includes new features such as Universal Clipboard, Siri integration, Apple Pay and much more.

Features of 13-inch MacBook Pro having traditional function keys

  • 3-inch LED-backlit Retina display
  • 0GHz dual-core Intel Core i5 or 2.4GHz dual-core Intel Core i7 processor
  • Turbo Boost up to 3.4GHz
  • Battery life of up to 10 hours
  • 1TB SSD Drive
  • Force Touch trackpad
  • 02 pounds weight

Features of The 13-inch MacBook Pro with the new Touch Bar

  • Touch Bar and Touch ID
  • 3-inch LED-backlit Retina display
  • 9GHz or 3.1GHz dual-core Intel Core i5 or 3.3GHz dual-core Intel Core i7 processor
  • Turbo Boost of up to 3.6GHz
  • Battery life up to 10 hours
  • 1TB SSD Drive
  • Force Touch trackpad
  • 02 pounds weight

Features of the 15-inch MacBook Pro with the Touch Bar

  • Touch Bar and Touch ID
  • 4-inch LED-backlit Retina display
  • 6GHz, 2.7GHz, or 2.9GHz quad-core Intel Core i7 processor
  • Turbo Boost of up to 3.8GHz
  • Battery life of up to 10 hours
  • 2TB SSD Drive
  • Force Touch trackpad
  • 02 pounds weight

The key highlight of the new MacBook models is the new Touch Bar which Apple showcased with third-party software like Adobe Photoshop. It was evident that how useful the new Touch Bar really is for the users. The same Touch Bar also comes with Touch ID hidden under the power button.

However, interested buyers will need to wait till these new MacBook come to the market.

For more technology and startup related news and updates, visit https://www.appsquadz.com/blog
